entities.name: griphook
entities.description: Griphook is mentioned as a goblin who has a rising color and gives a nasty laugh. He is also referred to as 'your race' by the Dark Lord, indicating that he is a member of a specific group.

entities.name: harry
entities.description: Harry is mentioned as noting Griphook's rising color and is part of the conversation about wizards versus goblins.

entities.name: hermione
entities.description: Hermione is mentioned as protesting against the Dark Lord's rule and is referred to as a 'Mudblood'.

entities.name: dark lord
entities.description: The Dark Lord is mentioned as becoming more powerful and setting wizards above goblins. He is also referred to as the one who rules Gringotts and allows house-elves to be slaughtered.

entities.name: goblins
entities.description: Goblins are mentioned as a group that is being oppressed by the Dark Lord's rule. They are referred to as 'your race' by the Dark Lord.

entities.name: house-elves
entities.description: House-elves are mentioned as being slaughtered under the Dark Lord's rule.

entities.name: gringotts
entities.description: Gringotts is mentioned as a place that falls under Wizarding rule.

entities.name: wizards
entities.description: Wizards are mentioned as the group in power under the Dark Lord's rule. They are referred to as 'your race' by the Dark Lord.

entities.name: mudbloods
entities.description: Mudbloods are mentioned as a group that is being hunted and oppressed by the Dark Lord's rule. Hermione refers to herself as a 'Mudblood'.

relationships.description: Griphook is oppressed by the Dark Lord's rule, as indicated by his rising color and the Dark Lord's words.
Hermione identifies with goblins as a group that is being oppressed by the Dark Lord's rule, referring to herself as a 'Mudblood'.
The Dark Lord oppresses goblins through his rule and policies, such as allowing house-elves to be slaughtered and Gringotts to fall under Wizarding rule.
The Dark Lord oppresses house-elves through his policies, such as allowing them to be slaughtered.
